===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あと}}

Originally an extension of {{m|ja|跡|tr=ato||footprint; leftover}}, itself a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あと|足|tr1=ato|t1=foot|所|tr2=to|t2=place}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あと|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あと}}

# {{qualifier|spatially}} the {{l|en|back}}, the {{l|en|rear}}, {{l|en|behind}}
# {{qualifier|temporally}} {{l|en|later}}, {{l|en|afterwards}}, some {{l|en|time}} {{l|en|after}} the {{l|en|present}}
# the [[rest]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うしろ}}

Probably from {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うしろ}}.  Usage examples appear in texts from at least the 900s.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  Ultimate derivation {{unk.|ja|sort=うしろ|nocap=1}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うしろ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|後ろ}} {{qualifier|more common}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うしろ}}

# the {{l|en|back}}, the {{l|en|rear}} {{qualifier|both spatially and temporally}}
# one's {{l|en|backside}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おくれ}}

The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|遅れる|tr=okureru||to be late; to be delayed; to come after something else}}.  Examples appear from at least the 1300s.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おくれ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|後れ}}, {{ja-l|遅れ}} {{qualifier|more common}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おくれ}}

# something {{l|en|later}}, {{l|en|after}}, or {{l|en|behind}}
# {{l|en|inferiority}}
# {{l|en|uncertainty}}, {{l|en|nervousness}}, {{l|en|indecision}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しり}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=しり}}.  Ultimate derivation {{unk.|ja|sort=しり|nocap=1}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しり|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しり}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しりえ}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=しりえ}}.  Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しりえ|尻|tr1=shiri|t1=butt, tail, rear|方|tr2=e|t2=side, facing, way, direction}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しりえ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

# the portion of a {{l|en|palace}} where a {{l|en|queen}} or other {{l|en|female}} {{l|en|imperial}} {{l|en|consort}} lives

{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|のち}}

{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆり}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ゆり}}.  Ultimate derivation {{unk.|ja|sort=ゆり|nocap=1}}.  May be cognate with {{m|ja|より|tr=yori||from; after}}.

===Etymology 8===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ご}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こう}} {{m|zh|後|tr={{IPAchar|/ɦəuX/}}, {{IPAchar|/ɦəuH/}}||after}}.  Classified as the ''[[唐音#Japanese|tōon]]'' or "Tang sound", so likely borrowed from the dialects spoken during the {{w|Tang dynasty}}.

{{ja-pron|yomi=toon|ご|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

===Etymology 9===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こう}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こう}} {{m|zh|後|tr={{IPAchar|/ɦəuX/}}||after}}.  Classified as the ''[[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]]'', so likely a later borrowing.  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''hòu''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|こう}}

# {{n-g|prefixing element in kanji compounds, adding a meaning of}} {{l|en|later}}, {{l|en|after}}, {{l|en|following}}, {{l|en|rearward}}

Only used in compounds.  Never used in isolation.
